stream_context.summary: Kaze designs the interior of a cowboy-themed "milk bar" saloon for the desert course, experiments with window effects, tweaks Dry Bones behaviour, and discusses a new runtime music decompression tech that inspires a physical soundtrack cartridge.
level: Cowboy desert – saloon / milk bar (part of RTYI Course)

development_findings.summary: Designed full saloon layout: bar on right, tables, small stage, upstairs balcony, swinging saloon doors, and a hidden ‘chalky milk’ speakeasy entered via an unmarked doorknob.
development_findings.quote: Somewhere along the walls there’s just going to be a doorknob … then you enter the room and there’s the bad guys.

development_findings.summary: Lore/gameplay tie-in: Dry Bones in this level drink milk, making them tougher; code changed so they now require a ground-pound to defeat.
development_findings.quote: Now you can no longer kill them with a ground pound… without a ground pound.

development_findings.summary: NPC hint created with ChatGPT-assisted cowboy dialect to teach players about tougher Dry Bones.
development_findings.quote: Reckon I give you a friendly tip: them Dry Bones up in them hills… your little hops ain’t gonna make a dent.

development_findings.summary: Implemented additive-blended window decals using Biobak’s combiner idea; aims for ~10 k polygons in main area, split into rooms to stay within N64 limits.
Keeps ROM size ≤ 8 MB; refuses expansion-pack features to preserve original hardware challenge.
development_findings.quote: Going beyond the original limitations is just kinda against the spirit of the challenge.

development_findings.summary: Exploring new N64 tech that decompresses songs (Opus/MP3) at runtime via libdragon; considering high-quality soundtrack shipping on its own cartridge.
development_findings.quote: If the whole decompressing MP3 on N64 in real time works out, I’m probably gonna make a separate cartridge … sell it for like a hundred dollars.

development_findings.summary: After watching Lost Impact speedruns, concluded later course themes feel uninspired; pivoting Course 13-15 brainstorming toward a space-station level with gravity tricks, discarding ‘music’, ‘oversized casino’, and ‘childhood dream’ drafts.
Plans to rework Course 2’s raft section into a platforming segment that introduces swing vines for more engaging play.
development_findings.quote: Instead, it’s gonna be mostly a platforming section … we even already have like fling vines.

development_findings.summary: Story overhaul pending: current slavery subplot feels too dark for Mario tone; little narrative has been implemented so changes are still feasible.
development_findings.quote: The whole slavery plot is a little bit dark for a Mario game.

development_findings.summary: Uses Git for backups and a custom Blender-to-decomp exporter; heavy reliance on ChatGPT for code snippets and dialogue polishing.
development_findings.quote: If you want to know how you combine two arrays in Unreal Engine 5 … you can just use ChatGPT.

context_findings.summary: Sees perpetual creation as life’s purpose; cannot imagine ‘just stopping’ making things.
context_findings.quote: What would be the point of an existence where you don’t create? That’s like the whole purpose of the human soul.

context_findings.summary: Strong stance that ROM-hack content should be free for others to reuse, given hacks already violate Nintendo’s consent.
context_findings.quote: If you hack someone else’s game without their consent you should also be fine with someone hacking your hack.

context_findings.summary: Embraces AI tools; believes critics are ‘coping’.
context_findings.quote: People that say it’s useless are just coping.

context_findings.summary: Personal wellness: on a calorie cut, increased squat weight, legs sore.
context_findings.quote: My fucking legs hurt so bad … I was doing squats today.

context_findings.summary: Prefers C over C++; views object-orientation as code style, not language feature.
context_findings.quote: There’s like no difference between C++ and C … being object-oriented is not a property of the language.

biobak.summary: Provided window ‘combiner’ technique and textures; Kaze integrates it for additive window decals.
biobak.quote: Dude, Biobak, we need to use your window technique here.

badub.summary: Will be paid for composing the OST if the physical soundtrack cartridge project proceeds.
badub.quote: I’m definitely gonna pay Badub for the OST if we do end up making that cartridge.

zeina.summary: Supplying additional window textures and responsible for upcoming Dry Bones animations.
zeina.quote: Are you also doing the Dry Bones animations? … Oh, okay Zeina. Skel sounds good.

zeina.summary: Proposed sticker merch designs; second-most active chatter in stream recap.

key_stories.title: Saloon & Chalky Milk Speakeasy
key_stories.summary: Kaze conceived a western milk bar where cowboys secretly drink ‘chalky milk’. He laid out the bar, balcony, stage and hidden room, coded tougher Dry Bones, and generated cowboy NPC hints with AI.
key_stories.challenge: Make the indoor area engaging and thematically funny.
key_stories.process: Sketched layout live, debated lore, modified enemy behaviour, wrote dialogue via ChatGPT.
key_stories.outcome: Functional room design finished; window effects implemented; secret door & animations still pending.
key_stories.key_quote: We got caught chalky handed – let’s get outta here, boys!

key_stories.title: Physical Soundtrack Cartridge Idea
key_stories.summary: New libdragon tech may stream compressed audio on real N64 hardware. Excited, Kaze proposes a separate RTYI OST cartridge with box and booklet sold for ~$100.
key_stories.challenge: Deliver high-quality music within N64 limits and fund collaborators.
key_stories.process: Researches Opus/MP3 runtime decompression, plans payment for Badub, discusses souvenir nature and free digital availability.
key_stories.outcome: Concept endorsed on stream; technical feasibility and legal/business steps undetermined.
key_stories.key_quote: It’s like theoretically useless but very cool – that’s what a souvenir is supposed to be.

key_stories.title: AI-Written Cowboy Dialogue
key_stories.summary: Struggled to phrase NPC advice in authentic western slang; turned to ChatGPT and quickly obtained satisfying text.
key_stories.process: Fed original line to ChatGPT, iterated until tone matched.
key_stories.outcome: Final NPC script adopted; demonstrates AI’s role in creative pipeline.
key_stories.key_quote: AI is a very good tool, case American arc anyway.

open_questions.context: Design calls for an invisible doorknob that blends into saloon wall leading to chalky milk room; not yet built.
questions: How will the player visually or acoustically detect the hidden doorknob?
Any fail-safe to prevent soft-locks if door is missed?
Will a camera hint or NPC clue guide discovery?

open_questions.context: Zeina tasked with new animations showing Dry Bones’ milk-strengthened bones; gameplay already altered.
questions: What specific animation changes will convey increased durability?
Timeline for delivering the new animations?
Need for additional visual effects (e.g., particle ‘milk aura’)?

open_questions.context: Cactus model promised by unnamed contributor never arrived after three weeks.
questions: Is another artist taking over the cactus assets?
Do you have fallback designs or will biome change?
What dependencies block level completion?

open_questions.context: Idea hinges on libdragon project that streams compressed audio at 30 Hz.
questions: What compression format and bandwidth are confirmed to work on real hardware?
How much PRG-RAM and RSP load does this incur?
Contingency plan if tech proves unstable?

open_questions.context: Plan to sell $100 souvenir cart with box and booklet; legal and production details unclear.
questions: Have manufacturing partners or PCB suppliers been contacted?
What is Nintendo’s likely response to a music-only cart?
How will revenue be split among team members?

open_questions.context: Kaze feels existing subplot too dark; wants rewrite.
questions: What narrative tone is now targeted?
Will previously built levels require dialogue or asset changes?
Which team member oversees overall story cohesion?

open_questions.context: Current drafts abandoned; only space station concept seems definite.
questions: Has the space-station design been green-lit?
What new ‘dream-inspired’ themes are being considered?
How will gravity mechanics be implemented technically?
